718650f-a.text:
Charlton Street, south side, west Irom Hudson to Greenwich Streets. In the foreground are several frame buildings (S. W. corner of Hudson Street) which are absent in 1922 and their site vacant according to Bromleys New York Atlas of that year. Note
the cobblestones and the horse car rails.
1G98
J. Corell
P. L. Sperr
718650f-a.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718649f-a.text:
Charlton Street, north side, clearing west of Hudson Street, looking across the future site of the Standard Statistics Building
to the houses on the north side of King Street.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
718649f-a.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720523f-a.text:
Hudson Street at Charlton Street, seen from the oleared N.W. corner, in the foreground, the block where the Standard Statistics
Building will rise.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720523f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charlton Street, Manhattan, NY

720527f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, from Charlton Street to King, showing the excavation for the new Standard Statistics Building.
April 23,1930.
P. L. Sperr.

718646f-a.text:
(1)
71 to 69 Charlton Street, north side, between Budson and Varick Streets. The No. 69 half of the building is frame behind its brick
facing.
1912.
(2)
The same, a winter view. About 1926 these houses will be torn
down for the building of a garage.
About 1912.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
